intro: Combretum jacquinii f. brasiliense, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that turn reddish in color during the dry season. Its bark is smooth and grayish, with a faintly aromatic scent.
